intro: Stenocarpus francii, commonly known as the Australian hakea, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and dense, evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in cylindrical inflorescences. Its fruit is a woody capsule that contains several seeds, which are released when the capsule dries and splits open. Stenocarpus francii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
